fields.label: Wrote a one-sentence 27-day outcome statement
fields.helperText: Paste your exact one-sentence outcome.

fields.label: Set a numeric money target for day 27
fields.helperText: Enter your target amount (number only) and note currency in your log.

fields.label: Set a weekly time budget and schedule windows
fields.helperText: List days of week with minutes available each day.

fields.label: Listed 3 to 5 constraints you will not violate
fields.helperText: List 3 to 5 constraints (one per line).

fields.label: Described the ideal customer in 2 sentences
fields.helperText: Paste the two sentences describing the customer.

fields.label: Wrote a one-sentence offer promise with a measurable outcome
fields.helperText: Paste the promise sentence.

fields.label: Defined the delivery method in one sentence
fields.helperText: Paste the delivery sentence.

fields.label: Wrote one purchase-trigger scenario
fields.helperText: Write 3 to 5 lines describing the moment they decide to pay.

fields.label: Created a decision log template with fields
fields.helperText: Paste the template fields you will reuse daily.

fields.label: Wrote 3 Week 1 decision rules
fields.helperText: List your three decision rules.

fields.label: Listed 3 assumptions you will test later
fields.helperText: List three assumptions (one per line).

fields.label: Wrote a stop rule for daily work
fields.helperText: Paste your one-sentence stop rule.

fields.label: Wrote a one-paragraph feasibility definition for this course
fields.helperText: Paste your feasibility definition paragraph.

fields.label: Listed your existing tools and skills that support a digital service
fields.helperText: List 6 to 12 tools/skills you already have.

fields.label: Drafted a 7-day launch path with numbered steps
fields.helperText: Write 5 to 7 numbered steps for the first week.

fields.label: Identified one feasibility red flag you will reject immediately
fields.helperText: Write one sentence naming your feasibility red flag.

fields.label: Wrote 3 first-transaction options with buyer, trigger, and price
fields.helperText: Paste three options. Each must include buyer, trigger, and price.

fields.label: Estimated delivery effort for each option in minutes
fields.helperText: Provide three minute estimates, one per option.

fields.label: Chose one option as your Month 1 $100 path
fields.helperText: Write one sentence: I choose option X because...

fields.label: Wrote one sentence explaining why the chosen path is worth paying for
fields.helperText: Paste your value explanation sentence.

fields.label: Created a persuasion card template with 5 fields
fields.helperText: Paste your 5-field template.

fields.label: Filled 3 persuasion cards for 3 service angles
fields.helperText: Paste three filled persuasion cards.

fields.label: Wrote a clear why-now sentence for the best card
fields.helperText: Paste the why-now sentence.

fields.label: Wrote one risk-reducer for the best card
fields.helperText: Write one line that reduces buyer risk (scope, timeline, guarantee, or clarity).

fields.label: Wrote 4 time waster idea seeds
fields.helperText: List four idea seeds based on time-wasting problems.

fields.label: Wrote 4 confusion to clarity idea seeds
fields.helperText: List four idea seeds where the customer wants clarity.

fields.label: Wrote 4 adapt an existing offer idea seeds
fields.helperText: List four idea seeds adapted from existing offers you have seen.

fields.label: Starred your top 5 idea seeds
fields.helperText: Mark five items in your 12-idea list as top candidates.

fields.label: Created an idea snapshot template with 7 fields
fields.helperText: Paste your 7-field snapshot template.

fields.label: Completed 5 idea snapshots using the template
fields.helperText: Paste five filled snapshots.

fields.label: Added a price guess for each snapshot
fields.helperText: Provide five price guesses, one per snapshot.

fields.label: Added a first-transaction channel for each snapshot
fields.helperText: List five channels, one per snapshot (DM, email, marketplace, landing page, etc.).

fields.label: Scored all 5 ideas on three criteria
fields.helperText: Provide 5 entries with feasibility, profit potential, and persuasion scores (1 to 5).

fields.label: Ranked the 5 ideas from best to worst
fields.helperText: List ideas ranked 1 to 5.

fields.label: Selected the top 3 candidates
fields.helperText: List the three selected idea titles.

fields.label: Wrote a one-sentence why-this-could-work for each top 3
fields.helperText: Paste three one-sentence reasons, one per selected idea.

fields.label: Listed 6 obstacles for Idea #1
fields.helperText: List six obstacles for your first idea.

fields.label: Listed 6 obstacles for Idea #2
fields.helperText: List six obstacles for your second idea.

fields.label: Listed 6 obstacles for Idea #3
fields.helperText: List six obstacles for your third idea.

fields.label: Marked top 2 launch blockers per idea and wrote mitigations
fields.helperText: Provide 6 blocker lines total, each followed by a mitigation line.

fields.label: Listed 6 opportunities for each of the top 3 ideas
fields.helperText: Paste three lists, each with six opportunities.

fields.label: Selected top 2 leverage points per idea
fields.helperText: List six leverage points total, labeled by idea.

fields.label: Wrote one design choice per leverage point
fields.helperText: Write six design-choice lines, one per leverage point.

fields.label: Wrote one unfair advantage sentence for each idea
fields.helperText: Paste three unfair-advantage sentences.

fields.label: Identified one biggest uncertainty for each of the top 3 ideas
fields.helperText: List three uncertainties, one per idea.

fields.label: Designed a 48-hour experiment for each uncertainty
fields.helperText: Describe three experiments, one per uncertainty.

fields.label: Wrote a kill rule for each idea
fields.helperText: Write three kill rules, one per idea.

fields.label: Chose one leading idea to take into Day 5 forecasting
fields.helperText: Write one sentence naming your leading idea and why.

fields.label: Wrote price, delivery time, and variable cost for Idea #1
fields.helperText: Enter the three numbers in your log for Idea #1 and note units/currency.

fields.label: Wrote price, delivery time, and variable cost for Idea #2
fields.helperText: Enter the three numbers in your log for Idea #2 and note units/currency.

fields.label: Wrote price, delivery time, and variable cost for Idea #3
fields.helperText: Enter the three numbers in your log for Idea #3 and note units/currency.

fields.label: Calculated gross profit per sale and profit per hour for all three
fields.helperText: Provide six calculated values: three gross profits and three profit-per-hour numbers.

fields.label: Calculated weekly delivery capacity for each of the top 3 ideas
fields.helperText: Provide three capacity numbers (customers per week), one per idea.

fields.label: Wrote cautious, base, and stretch scenarios for each idea
fields.helperText: Provide 9 scenario lines total (3 scenarios x 3 ideas).

fields.label: Estimated month-one revenue for each idea under base scenario
fields.helperText: Provide three base-scenario revenue numbers with currency noted in your log.

fields.label: Estimated month-one profit for each idea under base scenario
fields.helperText: Provide three base-scenario profit numbers and one assumption line for each.

fields.label: Selected one primary idea and one backup idea
fields.helperText: Write the two idea titles and label them primary and backup.

fields.label: Wrote a pricing hypothesis for the primary idea
fields.helperText: Paste one sentence with price and promised outcome.

fields.label: Listed 3 assumptions that must be true for the primary idea to work
fields.helperText: List three must-be-true assumptions.

fields.label: Wrote the next 3 actions you will take in Week 2
fields.helperText: Write three numbered next actions.

fields.label: Created a selector table with 6 criteria and 1 to 5 scale
fields.helperText: Paste your selector table headings and the 1 to 5 scale definition.

fields.label: Wrote scoring rules for each criterion
fields.helperText: List 6 short scoring rules, one per criterion.

fields.label: Added a notes field for evidence and assumptions
fields.helperText: Paste the notes field label or description you will use.

fields.label: Listed your candidate ideas to compare
fields.helperText: List 3 to 5 candidate idea titles added to the selector.

fields.label: Scored each idea on all 6 criteria
fields.helperText: Paste your completed score grid (idea rows x 6 criteria).

fields.label: Wrote at least 6 evidence notes across the table
fields.helperText: List at least 6 evidence notes you added to the selector.

fields.label: Calculated totals and ranked the ideas
fields.helperText: Provide totals per idea and a ranked list from best to worst.

fields.label: Flagged the top 2 risks for the highest-ranked idea
fields.helperText: List the top 2 risks for the leading idea.

fields.label: Selected a primary idea and a backup idea
fields.helperText: Write two titles labeled Primary and Backup.

fields.label: Wrote a decision note paragraph
fields.helperText: Paste your one-paragraph decision note.

fields.label: Defined 2 switch triggers based on evidence
fields.helperText: Write two rules in the form: If X evidence happens, I switch to backup.

fields.label: Wrote one next action for tomorrow's detective work
fields.helperText: Write one concrete action you will do in Day 7.

fields.label: Saved 10 links related to your primary idea
fields.helperText: List 10 URLs or reference links you collected.

fields.label: Recorded price points for at least 6 of them
fields.helperText: List at least 6 prices with currency and the matching link label.

fields.label: Recorded scope notes for all 10
fields.helperText: Provide 10 one-line scope notes, one per link.

fields.label: Recorded target customer signals for all 10
fields.helperText: Provide 10 one-line who it is for notes, one per link.

fields.label: Created 2 to 3 price bands with examples in each
fields.helperText: Write 2 to 3 price bands and list examples under each band.

fields.label: Listed the top 5 common deliverables or scope elements
fields.helperText: List 5 deliverables/scope elements that appeared repeatedly.

fields.label: Listed the top 5 common customer pain phrases or triggers
fields.helperText: List 5 phrases or triggers customers use to describe the problem.

fields.label: Identified one gap and one not-competing-on decision
fields.helperText: Write two lines: one gap you will target and one area you will not compete on.

fields.label: Selected a target price and a backup price using your bands
fields.helperText: Write your target price and backup price with a one-line justification for each.

fields.label: Wrote 5 scope boundaries for your service
fields.helperText: List 5 boundaries that define what is included and excluded.

fields.label: Chose a primary and secondary acquisition channel
fields.helperText: Name two channels and write one line on why each fits.

fields.label: Wrote one test plan for tomorrow's customer coffee exercise
fields.helperText: Write 3 lines describing what you will test about the customer tomorrow.

fields.label: Wrote a 12 to 16 line transcript with both voices
fields.helperText: Paste your full transcript (12 to 16 lines) showing both voices.

fields.label: Included the customer's current workaround and cost of it
fields.helperText: Paste the 2 lines where the customer describes the workaround and its cost.

fields.label: Included a clear why-now trigger
fields.helperText: Paste the line that shows why the customer wants a solution now.

fields.label: Included at least 2 customer fears or objections
fields.helperText: Paste 2 lines that show fears or objections.

fields.label: Collected 10 customer phrases
fields.helperText: List 10 phrases pulled from your transcript and evidence.

fields.label: Labeled each phrase by type
fields.helperText: Provide the same 10 phrases with labels: Pain, Outcome, Trigger, or Objection.

fields.label: Selected 3 phrases to use in your offer
fields.helperText: List the 3 phrases you will use directly in offer copy.

fields.label: Wrote one job to be done sentence
fields.helperText: Write one plain-English sentence describing what the customer hires you to do.

fields.label: Listed your top 5 objections
fields.helperText: List 5 objections in the customer's words.

fields.label: Wrote an offer design response for each objection
fields.helperText: Write 5 paired lines: objection then design response.

fields.label: Wrote 3 reassurance lines using customer language
fields.helperText: Write 3 short lines you could send in a message to reduce worry.

fields.label: Updated your scope boundaries based on objections
fields.helperText: Paste your updated scope boundaries or list the 2 changes you made.

fields.label: Wrote a one-paragraph offer summary
fields.helperText: Paste your one-paragraph offer summary.

fields.label: Listed 3 to 6 deliverables with a timeline
fields.helperText: List deliverables and include the delivery timeline next to each or overall.

fields.label: Listed 5 scope boundaries
fields.helperText: List 5 boundaries that define what is included and excluded.

fields.label: Listed customer inputs required to start
fields.helperText: List 3 to 5 inputs you need from the customer to begin.

fields.label: Set a core package price and wrote the price justification
fields.helperText: Write your core price and a 2-line justification based on evidence and effort.

fields.label: Defined one add-on with price and scope
fields.helperText: Describe one add-on, include its price and what it includes.

fields.label: Wrote a revision policy
fields.helperText: Write 3 to 5 lines that define revisions and limits.

fields.label: Wrote a refund policy or satisfaction rule
fields.helperText: Write 2 to 4 lines describing refunds or satisfaction conditions.

fields.label: Wrote a 6-step buyer flow
fields.helperText: Provide 6 numbered steps from first contact to delivery completion.

fields.label: Drafted a short call-to-action message
fields.helperText: Write a 4 to 7 line message someone could send to start the process.

fields.label: Wrote a what-you-get list with 5 bullets
fields.helperText: List 5 bullets describing what the customer receives.

fields.label: Wrote a short scope warning line to prevent mismatch
fields.helperText: Write one sentence that warns about fit and scope.

fields.label: Wrote the scene in 2 to 3 sentences
fields.helperText: Paste your 2 to 3 sentence scene.

fields.label: Wrote the insight in 2 to 3 sentences
fields.helperText: Paste your 2 to 3 sentence insight.

fields.label: Wrote the decision and outcome link in 2 to 3 sentences
fields.helperText: Paste your 2 to 3 sentence decision and outcome link.

fields.label: Produced a single 120 to 170 word combined origin story
fields.helperText: Paste the final origin story (120 to 170 words).

fields.label: Wrote a 5-step delivery process
fields.helperText: List 5 numbered steps describing your delivery process.

fields.label: Wrote 3 credibility proof points
fields.helperText: List 3 proof points that do not require testimonials.

fields.label: Wrote one short bio line
fields.helperText: Write a one-sentence bio aligned to the offer.

fields.label: Wrote one what-I-will-not-do line
fields.helperText: Write one sentence that sets expectations by stating what you will not do.

fields.label: Wrote a one-sentence pitch
fields.helperText: Paste your one-sentence pitch with outcome and timeframe.

fields.label: Wrote a 70 to 100 word paragraph pitch
fields.helperText: Paste your paragraph pitch (70 to 100 words).

fields.label: Wrote a 6 to 9 line outreach message
fields.helperText: Paste the outreach message (6 to 9 lines) inviting a simple next step.

fields.label: Wrote a subject line or opener for your message
fields.helperText: Write one subject line or opening line.

fields.label: Which nuts and bolts did you set up today?
fields.helperText: Check all the spine pieces you already have or set up today

fields.label: What is the biggest missing piece right now?
fields.helperText: The one thing blocking you from launching. Example: No landing page to explain my offer

fields.label: What is your most resourceful shortcut to get it done fast?
fields.helperText: Example: Use a free Carrd template, borrow a friend's Notion layout, copy a competitor's structure

fields.label: Who or what will you ask for help today?
fields.helperText: A person, community, template, tool, or tutorial. Example: Ask my designer friend for a quick logo, use Canva templates

fields.label: I drafted a basic agreement (what, how much, when)
Paste your basic agreement in 3 lines (what, how much, when)
fields.helperText: Example: I will deliver a 30-minute coaching call within 7 days. Cost is $75. Payment due before the call via PayPal.

fields.label: Your next action in the next 24 hours (one sentence)
fields.helperText: Example: Set up a Carrd landing page and share the link with 3 friends for feedback

fields.label: What are you selling today? (one sentence offer)
fields.helperText: Example: A 60-minute resume rewrite plus a 15-minute feedback call

fields.label: Direct cash cost per sale (fees, materials, shipping, tools)
fields.helperText: Add up platform fees, materials, shipping, and any tool costs per sale. Example: 5

fields.label: Time cost per sale (hours, realistic estimate)
fields.helperText: Include prep, delivery, and follow-up. Be honest. Example: 2.5

fields.label: Minimum hourly value you want (or equivalent)
fields.helperText: The minimum you are willing to earn per hour. Example: 25

fields.label: Your minimum workable price (cost-plus result)
fields.helperText: Formula: (hours x hourly value) + cash costs. Example: (2.5 x 25) + 5 = 67.50

fields.label: Your starting launch price
fields.helperText: A realistic price between your minimum and what the market can bear. Example: 75

fields.label: Pricing model you will use (for now)
Why this price makes sense (and how it feels to publish it)
fields.helperText: Example: $75 covers my costs and gives me $25 per hour. It feels slightly scary but fair for the value.

fields.label: Write your 3-step recipe (Step 1 create, Step 2 publish, Step 3 revenue)
fields.helperText: Example: Step 1: Record video tutorials. Step 2: Upload to Gumroad with sales page. Step 3: Share link and accept payment.

fields.label: List the ingredients you must source or create (tools, assets, access, help)
fields.helperText: Example: Screen recording software, microphone, Gumroad account, thumbnail designs, email template

fields.label: List the deliverables the customer receives (exact items)
fields.helperText: Example: 5 video lessons (10 min each), 1 PDF checklist, 1 template spreadsheet, access to private Discord

fields.label: What is the single most urgent missing ingredient?
fields.helperText: The one thing blocking progress. Example: Screen recording software

fields.label: Where will you get it within 48 hours? (link, shop, person, platform)
fields.helperText: Example: Download Loom free trial from loom.com

fields.label: How will you source it?
Estimated cost to acquire the urgent ingredient
fields.helperText: Enter 0 if free. Example: 0

fields.label: Which payment method(s) will you accept at launch?
fields.helperText: Check all that apply for your first launch

fields.label: Paste your payment link or checkout URL
fields.helperText: Example: https://pay.stripe.com/link123 or your Gumroad product page

fields.label: I tested the payment flow end to end (pay, confirmation, delivery)
Write your one-sentence refund policy
fields.helperText: Example: Full refund if you are not satisfied within 7 days, no questions asked.

fields.label: Write your one-sentence delivery promise (what happens after they pay)
fields.helperText: Example: You will receive a confirmation email with download link within 5 minutes of purchase.

fields.label: Paste your basic agreement (what you do, how much, when paid)
fields.helperText: Your 3-line agreement from Day 11, updated with any changes

fields.label: Support email customers should use
fields.helperText: Example: help@yoursite.com or your personal email

fields.label: Write your workflow from discovery to delivery (numbered steps)
fields.helperText: At least 12 steps. Example: 1. Customer finds landing page. 2. Reads offer. 3. Clicks buy...

fields.label: Write 4 onboarding messages (welcome, how to start, tips, check-in)
fields.helperText: 1. Welcome message with next steps. 2. How to get started. 3. One helpful tip. 4. Check-in after a few days.

fields.label: What could go wrong? Select your top risks
fields.helperText: Check the most likely failure points for your workflow

fields.label: For 2 risks, write the fix and the exact message you will send
fields.helperText: Example: Risk 1: Customer did not get email. Fix: Check spam, resend manually. Message: Hi! I noticed you might not have received my email. Here it is again...

fields.label: One automation or template you will build next (one sentence)
fields.helperText: Example: Create a Zapier automation to send confirmation emails

fields.label: Where will you store customer info and orders?
fields.helperText: Example: Google Sheet, Notion database, Airtable, CRM

fields.label: How clear is the customer benefit today?
fields.helperText: 1 = very unclear, 5 = crystal clear

fields.label: How clear is your income plan today?
fields.helperText: 1 = very unclear, 5 = crystal clear

fields.label: List 3 actions that improve customer benefit (specific)
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Add a quick-start checklist to the product. 2. Record a walkthrough video. 3. Simplify the first step.

fields.label: List 3 actions that increase income (specific)
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Send 3 outreach DMs to potential customers. 2. Post the offer on LinkedIn. 3. Ask a happy customer for a referral.

fields.label: List 3 low-value tasks you will stop or postpone
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Stop tweaking the logo. 2. Pause social media scheduling setup. 3. Defer building an email sequence.

fields.label: Your 25-minute Make Something block for tomorrow morning (exact task)
fields.helperText: Example: Tomorrow at 7am I will write the welcome email sequence

fields.label: I will spend 10 percent more time on:
Sales page/listing finalized with offer + price
Complete flow tested (view → buy → payment)
Offer published and publicly accessible
Live URL of your offer
Where did you share it? (link or description)
How does it feel to be live?
10 people who match your ideal customer profile
Your personalized outreach message
Messages sent to all 10 people
Number of responses received
Summary of responses (what did they say?)
10 people in your network who might help
Type of asks made
Asks sent to all 10 people
Who said yes? What did they offer?
Patterns from Days 17-19 responses
Most common objections or questions
Improvement made to offer or messaging
Followed up with 'maybe' responses
Type of urgency created
Describe your time-limited offer
Deadline date
Offer communicated to audience
Where did you share it?
Have you made a sale?
Amount of first sale(s)
Channel/source of sale
Customer details (anonymous is fine)
What made the sale happen (or what's blocking it)?
If no sale: 3 most likely paths to first sale
Your 'first dollar' story (shareable version)
Total page/offer views
Click-through rate (if applicable)
Total responses received
Total sales
Total revenue
Conversion rate (sales/views)
Biggest bottleneck (where are people dropping off?)
3 actions to improve the bottleneck
Top-performing channel
Top-performing message/approach
What to stop (not working)
How to 2x effort on what's working
Strategy document updated
People who showed interest but didn't buy
Potential upsells or add-ons
Referral opportunities from happy customers
One 'rock' you'll pursue this week
Customer acquisition workflow: How do people find you?
Sales process: How do people buy?
Delivery process: How do you fulfill?
One-page operations summary
Retrospective: What worked?
What didn't work?
What surprised you?
90-day goal: Target revenue
90-day goal: Target customers
90-day goal: Product/offer improvements
The single biggest lever to pull next month
Recurring time scheduled for side hustle
fields.helperText: e.g., Tues/Thurs 7-8pm
